acs.title: Coupang Digital VI System ‚Äì Apple Care Service (ACS)
acs.desc:
ACS (Apple Care Service) is a service that allows customers who purchase Apple devices on Coupang to pay for the existing one-time insurance product, Apple Care+, through a monthly subscription plan.
This reduces the initial cost burden and aims to attract more customers.
The service architecture is designed to be expandable beyond Apple Care+, enabling support for other device warranty and insurance products in the future.

Registration and modification of payment methods for subscriptions
Subscription cancellation and withdrawal processes
Subscription status management via the admin page
Multi-platform support: PC/Mobile Web, WebView
Development and operation of API, interface, and batch processes

techSupport.title: Real-time Automobile Tech Support Platform (Prototype)
techSupport.desc: A prototype platform that enables workers in automobile maintenance sites to receive remote technical support through real-time video, audio, and chat. The system leverages AWS Chime (WebRTC) for live communication, Redis and PostgreSQL for session/matching management, and SSE for instant notifications to deliver a stable and interactive support experience.
features: One-time login using nickname with session-based authentication
1:1 automatic worker-supporter matching (FIFO queue based)
Real-time video/audio/text chat via AWS Chime (WebRTC, Data Channel)
Connection/session management using Redis with TTL-based auto-cleanup
Persistent user, meeting, and matching data stored in PostgreSQL
Server-Sent Events (SSE) for real-time request, acceptance, and termination notifications
Jenkins pipeline for automated deployment of Spring Boot REST APIs
role: Frontend Development: Developed React/TypeScript-based UI and API integrations
Backend Development: Implemented Spring Boot REST APIs, AWS Chime integration, and SSE notification flow
Infrastructure: Designed PostgreSQL schema and created Jenkins CI/CD pipeline
contributions: Designed and implemented Spring Boot REST APIs and integrated AWS Chime SDK to provide real-time video, audio, and text chat
Implemented termination flow with AWS DeleteMeeting API and DB cleanup logic to prevent unnecessary billing
Designed PostgreSQL schema and implemented matching/meeting data management logic
Built Jenkins pipeline to enable automated build, test, and deployment of the backend application
Developed basic React/TypeScript UI for login, support request, and meeting room, and integrated with backend APIs
